> Anybody read anything applicable to 'optimized neural network calculation'?
> Maybe have some suggestions on things to read up on?  :)

I'm not really sure how anyone else has implemented their activiation
propagation algorithms, but I have a hunch that the most optimized method
for calculating this is to set up the directed network graph as an edge
matrix and then just perform repeated matrix multiplication until the
activation settles (or whatever stopping criterion you use). There are
some pretty sick multiplication algorithms for larger matrices that work
in about O(n^2.8) plus some large constant factor. I think most
advanced numerical analysis textbooks cover this.

Anyone else know of any research?

Joe
